name: Ajahn Mun Bhuridatta
what_did:
Ajahn Mun was a forest monk who lived simply and quietly.
He taught deep meditation and helped start the Thai Forest Tradition.
He walked through jungles to find quiet places to practice and teach.
why_matters:
Ajahn Mun inspired many monks to live peaceful, thoughtful lives.
His teachings are still followed in Thailand and around the world.

questions.q: What kind of monk was Ajahn Mun?
Where did Ajahn Mun go to practice?
What tradition did he help start?
Why do people remember Ajahn Mun?
options: He lived simply and taught meditation

fun_fact: He sometimes meditated in tiger-filled jungles — and stayed calm!
